p: Dietary supplementation of essential oils or oleoresins of rosemary, garlic, oregano, or ginger (500 mg/kg) failed to change the pork quality attributes and fatty acid profile, but the oregano-fed pork showed a tendency for less lipid oxidation ( Janz et al., 2007). A feed additive of oregano essential oil and sweet chestnut wood extract increased anti-oxidant species in the blood, induced higher levels of glutathione peroxidase and glutathione reductase, and prevented lipid oxidation of pork, but did not affect the cooking loss, drip loss, Warner-Bratzler shear force values, and chemical composition of the pork ( Ranucci et al., 2015).
